byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ, PATRICIA COHEN and KATIE THOMAS

abstract: American businesses express disappointment with House's rejection of legislation dealing with aid to workers harmed by imports; manufacturers have been vocal in their support of Trans-Pacific Partnership, agreement now in jeopardy.
lead_paragraph: Corporate America has been nearly unified in its support of a deal that would lower various barriers to trade and investment between the United States and 11 other Pacific Rim nations.

headline.main: Business Leaders React With Dismay to Defeat of Trade Bill
headline.print_headline: Business Leaders React With Dismay to Defeat of Trade Bill

snippet: Corporate America has been nearly unified in its support of a deal that would lower various barriers to trade and investment between the United States and 11 other Pacific Rim nations.
